00087 TileEngine::TileEngine() :
00088     width(0),
00089     height(0),
00090     bufData(NULL),
00091     colBytes(0),
00092     rowBytes(0),
00093     tileFormat(TILE_FORMAT_BYTE_UNSIGNED),
00094     floatOffset((float)0.0),
00095     floatScale((float)1.0),
00096     tileShift(0),
00097     tileMask(~0)
00098 {
00099 }
00100 
00101 
00102 TileEngine::~TileEngine()
00103 {
00104 }

00107 void TileEngine::setBuffer(
00108    void *buf)
00109 {
00110     bufData = buf;
00111 }
00112 
00113 
00114 unsigned long TileEngine::getValue(
00115     int col,
00116     int row,
00117     PyObject *tileFunction,
00118     const int *tileMapData,
00119     unsigned int tileMapCount)
00120 {
00121     if ((bufData == NULL) ||
00122         (col < 0) ||
00123         (col >= width) ||
00124         (row < 0) ||
00125         (row >= height)) {
00126         return 0;
00127     }
00128 
00129     int tile = 0;
00130 
00131     switch (tileFormat) {
00132 
00133         case TILE_FORMAT_BYTE_UNSIGNED:
00134             tile = 
00135                 (int)(
00136                     *(unsigned char *)(
00137                         (unsigned char *)bufData +
00138                         (col * colBytes) +
00139                         (row * rowBytes)));
00140             break;
00141 
00142         case TILE_FORMAT_BYTE_SIGNED:
00143             tile = 
00144                 (int)(
00145                     *(char *)(
00146                         (char *)bufData +
00147                         (col * colBytes) +
00148                         (row * rowBytes)));
00149             break;
00150 
00151         case TILE_FORMAT_SHORT_UNSIGNED:
00152             tile = 
00153                 (int)(
00154                     *(unsigned short *)(
00155                         (unsigned char *)bufData +
00156                         (col * colBytes) +
00157                         (row * rowBytes)));
00158             break;
00159 
00160         case TILE_FORMAT_SHORT_SIGNED:
00161             tile = 
00162                 (int)(
00163                     *(short *)(
00164                         (unsigned char *)bufData +
00165                         (col * colBytes) +
00166                         (row * rowBytes)));
00167             break;
00168 
00169         case TILE_FORMAT_LONG_UNSIGNED:
00170             tile =
00171                 (int)(
00172                     0x7fffffff &
00173                     *(unsigned long *)(
00174                         (unsigned char *)bufData +
00175                         (col * colBytes) +
00176                         (row * rowBytes)));
00177             break;
00178 
00179         case TILE_FORMAT_LONG_SIGNED:
00180             tile =
00181                 (int)(
00182                     *(unsigned long *)(
00183                         (unsigned char *)bufData +
00184                         (col * colBytes) +
00185                         (row * rowBytes)));
00186             break;
00187 
00188         case TILE_FORMAT_FLOAT:
00189             tile =
00190                 (int)(
00191                     floatOffset +
00192                     (floatScale *
00193                         *(float *)(
00194                             (unsigned char *)bufData +
00195                             (col * colBytes) +
00196                             (row * rowBytes))));
00197               break;
00198 
00199         case TILE_FORMAT_DOUBLE:
00200             tile =
00201                 (int)(
00202                     floatOffset +
00203                     (floatScale *
00204                         *(double *)(
00205                             (unsigned char *)bufData +
00206                             (col * colBytes) +
00207                             (row * rowBytes))));
00208             break;
00209 
00210         default:
00211             tile = 0;
00212             break;
00213 
00214     }
00215 
00216     if (tileFunction &&
00217         tileFunction != Py_None) {
00218         // Call tile function.
00219         PyObject *result =
00220             PyObject_CallFunction(
00221                 tileFunction,
00222                 "iii",
00223                 col,
00224                 row,
00225                 tile);
00226         if (!PyNumber_Check(result)) {
00227               PyErr_SetString(
00228                   PyExc_TypeError,
00229                   "expected tileFunction to return an integer");
00230         } else {
00231             tile = (unsigned long)PyInt_AsLong(result);
00232         }
00233         Py_DECREF(result);
00234     }
00235 
00236     tile <<= tileShift;
00237     tile &= tileMask;
00238 
00239     if (tileMapData != NULL) {
00240         tile = tileMapData[tile % tileMapCount];
00241     }
00242 
00243     return tile;
00244 }
00245 
00246 
00247 // Render fixed sized tiles, pre-drawn into the Cairo surface "tiles".
00248 void TileEngine::renderTiles(
00249     cairo_t *ctx,
00250     cairo_surface_t *tilesSurf,
00251     int tilesWidth,
00252     int tilesHeight,
00253     PyObject *tileFunction,
00254     PyObject *tileMap,
00255     int tileSize,
00256     int renderCol,
00257     int renderRow,
00258     int renderCols,
00259     int renderRows,
00260     double alpha)
00261 {
00262 
00263     if ((tileFunction != Py_None) &&
00264         !PyCallable_Check(tileFunction)) {
00265         PyErr_SetString(
00266             PyExc_TypeError,
00267             "expected tileFunction to be a callable function or None");
00268         return;
00269     }
00270 
00271     // The tileMap should be an array of 4 byte integers,
00272     // mapping virtual tiles indices to absolute tile numbers.
00273     if ((tileMap != Py_None) &&
00274         !PySequence_Check(tileMap)) {
00275         PyErr_SetString(
00276             PyExc_TypeError,
00277             "expected tileMap to be an array "
00278             "of 4 byte integers or None");
00279         return;
00280     }
00281 
00282     const int *tileMapData = NULL;
00283     unsigned int tileMapCount = 0;
00284 
00285     if (tileMap != Py_None) {
00286         tileMapCount = (unsigned int)PySequence_Size(tileMap);
00287         Py_ssize_t tileMapLength = 0;
00288         if (PyObject_AsReadBuffer(
00289             tileMap,
00290             (const void **)&tileMapData,
00291             &tileMapLength) != 0) {
00292             PyErr_SetString(
00293                 PyExc_TypeError,
00294                 "expected tileMap with read buffer");
00295             return;
00296         }
00297 
00298         int tileMapDataCount = 
00299             (int)tileMapLength / sizeof(unsigned int);
00300 
00301         if (tileMapDataCount != (int)tileMapCount) {
00302             PyErr_SetString(
00303                 PyExc_TypeError,
00304                 "expected tileMap read buffer of 4 byte integers");
00305             return;
00306         }
00307     }
00308 
00309     int tilesPerRow = tilesWidth / tileSize;
00310 
00311     int renderX = renderCol * tileSize;
00312     int renderY = renderRow * tileSize;
00313 
00314     int r;
00315     for (r = 0; r < renderRows; r++) {
00316         int c;
00317         for (c = 0; c  < renderCols; c++) {
00318             int col = (renderCol + c) % width;
00319             int row = (renderRow + r) % height;
00320 
00321             unsigned long tile =
00322                 getValue(
00323                     col,
00324                     row,
00325                     tileFunction,
00326                     tileMapData,
00327                     tileMapCount);
00328 
00329             double x = col * tileSize;
00330             double y = row * tileSize;
00331 
00332             // Tiles are arranged in a regular grid. 
00333             // Calculate the position of the file in the 
00334             // source tileSurf. 
00335             int tileCol = tile % tilesPerRow;
00336             int tileRow = tile / tilesPerRow;
00337             int tileX = tileCol * tileSize;
00338             int tileY = tileRow * tileSize;
00339 
00340             // Draw a tile.
00341 
00342             cairo_save(ctx);
00343 
00344             cairo_translate(
00345                 ctx,
00346                 x - renderX,
00347                 y - renderY);
00348 
00349             cairo_rectangle(
00350                 ctx,
00351                 0,
00352                 0,
00353                 tileSize,
00354                 tileSize);
00355 
00356             cairo_clip(ctx);
00357 
00358             cairo_set_source_surface(
00359                 ctx,
00360                 tilesSurf,
00361                 -tileX,
00362                 -tileY);
00363 
00364             if (alpha >= 1.0) {
00365                 cairo_paint(ctx);
00366             } else {
00367                 cairo_paint_with_alpha(ctx, alpha);
00368             }
00369 
00370             cairo_restore(ctx);
00371 
00372         }
00373     }
00374 }
00375 
00376 
00377 void TileEngine::renderTilesLazy(
00378     cairo_t *ctx,
00379     PyObject *tileFunction,
00380     PyObject *tileMap,
00381     int tileSize,
00382     int renderCol,
00383     int renderRow,
00384     int renderCols,
00385     int renderRows,
00386     double alpha,
00387     PyObject *tileGenerator,
00388     PyObject *tileCache,
00389     PyObject *tileCacheSurfaces,
00390     PyObject *tileState)
00391 {
00392     if ((tileFunction != Py_None) &&
00393         !PyCallable_Check(tileFunction)) {
00394         PyErr_SetString(
00395             PyExc_TypeError,
00396             "expected tileFunction to be a callable function or None");
00397         return;
00398     }
00399 
00400     // The tileMap should be None, or an array of 4 byte integers,
00401     // mapping virtual tiles indices to absolute tile numbers.
00402 
00403     const int *tileMapData = NULL;
00404     unsigned int tileMapCount = 0;
00405 
00406     if (tileMap != Py_None) {
00407 
00408       if (!PySequence_Check(tileMap)) {
00409             PyErr_SetString(
00410                 PyExc_TypeError,
00411                 "expected tileMap to be an array "
00412                 "of 4 byte integers or None");
00413             return;
00414         }
00415 
00416         tileMapCount = (unsigned int)PySequence_Size(tileMap);
00417         Py_ssize_t tileMapLength = 0;
00418         if (PyObject_AsReadBuffer(
00419             tileMap,
00420             (const void **)&tileMapData,
00421             &tileMapLength) != 0) {
00422             PyErr_SetString(
00423                 PyExc_TypeError,
00424                 "expected tileMap with read buffer");
00425             return;
00426         }
00427 
00428         int tileMapDataCount = 
00429             (int)tileMapLength / sizeof(unsigned int);
00430 
00431         if (tileMapDataCount != (int)tileMapCount) {
00432             PyErr_SetString(
00433                 PyExc_TypeError,
00434                 "expected tileMap read buffer of 4 byte integers");
00435             return;
00436         }
00437     }
00438 
00439     // The tileGenerator should be a function that takes one integer
00440     // tile parameter, and returns a tuple of three integers: a
00441     // surface index, a tileX and a tileY position.
00442     if (!PyCallable_Check(tileGenerator)) {
00443         PyErr_SetString(
00444             PyExc_TypeError,
00445             "expected tileGenerator callable object");
00446         return;
00447     }
00448 
00449     // The tileCache should be an array of integers, 4 integers per
00450     // tile.  The first is a "cached" flag, the second is a surface
00451     // index, the 3rd and 4th are a tileX and tileY position.
00452 
00453     int *tileCacheData = NULL;
00454     Py_ssize_t tileCacheLength = 0;
00455 
00456     if (PyObject_AsWriteBuffer(
00457         tileCache,
00458         (void **)&tileCacheData,
00459         &tileCacheLength) != 0) {
00460         PyErr_SetString(
00461             PyExc_TypeError,
00462             "expected tileCache array");
00463         return;
00464     }
00465 
00466     // The tileCacheSurfaces parameters should be a list of Cairo
00467     // surfaces.
00468     if (!PySequence_Check(tileCacheSurfaces)) {
00469         PyErr_SetString(
00470             PyExc_TypeError,
00471             "expected tileCacheSurfaces sequence");
00472         return;
00473     }
00474 
00475     // The tileState parameters should be None or a list of tile state
00476     // parameters.
00477     if ((tileState != Py_None) &&
00478         !PySequence_Check(tileState)) {
00479         PyErr_SetString(
00480             PyExc_TypeError,
00481             "expected tileState sequence or None");
00482         return;
00483     }
00484 
00485     int renderX = renderCol * tileSize;
00486     int renderY = renderRow * tileSize;
00487 
00488     int r;
00489     for (r = 0; r < renderRows; r++) {
00490         int c;
00491         for (c = 0; c  < renderCols; c++) {
00492             int col = (renderCol + c) % width;
00493             int row = (renderRow + r) % height;
00494 
00495             unsigned long tile = 
00496                 getValue(
00497                     col,
00498                     row,
00499                     tileFunction,
00500                     tileMapData,
00501                     tileMapCount);
00502 
00503             double x = col * tileSize;
00504             double y = row * tileSize;
00505 
00506             // Get the tile surface index, tileX and tileY from the
00507             // cache, or call the tileGenerator function to produce
00508             // them, if they are not already cached.
00509 
00510             int cacheOffset = tile * 4;
00511             int tileSurfaceIndex = 0;
00512             int tileX = 0;
00513             int tileY = 0;
00514 
00515             if (tileCacheData[cacheOffset + 0]) {
00516 
00517                 // The tile is already cached. 
00518                 // Get the values from the tileCache. 
00519 
00520                 tileSurfaceIndex = tileCacheData[cacheOffset + 1];
00521                 tileX = tileCacheData[cacheOffset + 2];
00522                 tileY = tileCacheData[cacheOffset + 3];
00523 
00524             } else {
00525 
00526                 // The tile has not already been cached.  Call the
00527                 // tileGenerator function to produce the tile, passing
00528                 // it the absolute tile number as a parameter.
00529 
00530                 // Mark the tile as cached, so we don't do this again. 
00531                 tileCacheData[cacheOffset + 0] = 1;
00532 
00533                 PyObject *result =
00534                     PyObject_CallFunction(
00535                         tileGenerator,
00536                         "i",
00537                         tile);
00538 
00539                 // The tile function returns a tuple of three numbers:
00540                 // the surface index (into the tileCacheSurfaces array
00541                 // of Cairo surfaces), the tileX and tileY position in
00542                 // the surface.
00543 
00544                 if (result == NULL) {
00545                     PyErr_SetString(
00546                         PyExc_TypeError,
00547                         "tile generator did not return a result");
00548                     return;
00549                 }
00550 
00551                 int success =
00552                     PyArg_ParseTuple(
00553                         result,
00554                         "iii",
00555                         &tileSurfaceIndex,
00556                         &tileX,
00557                         &tileY);
00558                 Py_DECREF(result);
00559                 if (!success) {
00560                     PyErr_SetString(
00561                         PyExc_TypeError,
00562                         "tile generator return wrong number of "
00563                         "results in tuple");
00564                     return;
00565                 }
00566 
00567                 // Cache the returned values. 
00568                 tileCacheData[cacheOffset + 1] = tileSurfaceIndex;
00569                 tileCacheData[cacheOffset + 2] = tileX;
00570                 tileCacheData[cacheOffset + 3] = tileY;
00571             }
00572 
00573             // Get the Python object wrapping the Cairo surface for
00574             // the tile.
00575             PyObject *tiles =
00576                 PySequence_GetItem(
00577                     tileCacheSurfaces,
00578                     tileSurfaceIndex);
00579 
00580             if (tiles == NULL) {
00581                 PyErr_SetString(
00582                     PyExc_TypeError,
00583                     "tile generator returned invalid tile "
00584                     "surface index");
00585                 return;
00586             }
00587 
00588             if (!PyObject_TypeCheck(
00589                   tiles,
00590                   &PycairoSurface_Type)) {
00591                 PyErr_SetString(
00592                     PyExc_TypeError,
00593                     "expected cairo_surface_t objects "
00594                     "in tileCacheSurfaces");
00595                 return;
00596             }
00597 
00598             // Get the cairo_surface_t from the Python object.
00599             cairo_surface_t *tilesSurf = PycairoSurface_GET(tiles);
00600             Py_DECREF(tiles);
00601 
00602             // Draw a tile.
00603 
00604             cairo_save(ctx);
00605 
00606             cairo_translate(
00607                 ctx,
00608                 x - renderX,
00609                 y - renderY);
00610 
00611             cairo_rectangle(
00612                 ctx,
00613                 0,
00614                 0,
00615                 tileSize,
00616                 tileSize);
00617 
00618             cairo_clip(ctx);
00619 
00620             cairo_set_source_surface(
00621                 ctx,
00622                 tilesSurf,
00623                 -tileX,
00624                 -tileY);
00625 
00626             if (alpha >= 1.0) {
00627                 cairo_paint(ctx);
00628             } else {
00629                 cairo_paint_with_alpha(ctx, alpha);
00630             }
00631 
00632             cairo_restore(ctx);
00633         }
00634     }
00635 }
00636 
00637 
00638 void TileEngine::renderPixels(
00639     cairo_surface_t *destSurf,
00640     cairo_surface_t *cmapSurf,
00641     PyObject *tileFunction,
00642     PyObject *tileMap,
00643     int renderCol,
00644     int renderRow,
00645     int renderCols,
00646     int renderRows)
00647 {
00648     if ((tileFunction != Py_None) &&
00649         !PyCallable_Check(tileFunction)) {
00650         PyErr_SetString(
00651             PyExc_TypeError,
00652             "expected tileFunction to be a callable function or None");
00653         return;
00654     }
00655 
00656     // The tileMap should be None, or an array of 4 byte integers,
00657     // mapping virtual tiles indices to absolute tile numbers.
00658 
00659     const int *tileMapData = NULL;
00660     unsigned int tileMapCount = 0;
00661 
00662     if (tileMap != Py_None) {
00663 
00664         if (!PySequence_Check(tileMap)) {
00665             PyErr_SetString(
00666                 PyExc_TypeError,
00667                 "expected tileMap to be an array "
00668                 "of 4 byte integers or None");
00669             return;
00670         }
00671 
00672         tileMapCount = (unsigned int)PySequence_Size(tileMap);
00673         Py_ssize_t tileMapLength = 0;
00674         if (PyObject_AsReadBuffer(
00675             tileMap,
00676             (const void **)&tileMapData,
00677             &tileMapLength) != 0) {
00678             PyErr_SetString(
00679                 PyExc_TypeError,
00680                 "expected tileMap with read buffer");
00681             return;
00682         }
00683 
00684         int tileMapDataCount = 
00685             (int)tileMapLength / sizeof(unsigned int);
00686 
00687         if (tileMapDataCount != (int)tileMapCount) {
00688           PyErr_SetString(
00689             PyExc_TypeError,
00690             "expected tileMap read buffer of 4 byte integers");
00691           return;
00692         }
00693     }
00694 
00695     unsigned char *destData = cairo_image_surface_get_data(destSurf);
00696     int destStride = cairo_image_surface_get_stride(destSurf);
00697 
00698     unsigned char *cmapData = cairo_image_surface_get_data(cmapSurf);
00699     int cmapWidth = cairo_image_surface_get_width(cmapSurf);
00700     int cmapStride = cairo_image_surface_get_stride(cmapSurf);
00701 
00702     int r;
00703     for (r = 0; r < renderRows; r++) {
00704         int c;
00705         for (c = 0; c  < renderCols; c++) {
00706             int col = (renderCol + c) % width;
00707             int row = (renderRow + r) % height;
00708 
00709             unsigned long tile = 
00710                 getValue(
00711                     col,
00712                     row,
00713                     tileFunction,
00714                     tileMapData,
00715                     tileMapCount);
00716 
00717             int sourceX = tile % cmapWidth;
00718             int sourceY = tile / cmapWidth;
00719 
00720             unsigned char *sourcePixel =
00721                 cmapData +
00722                 (sourceX * 4) +
00723                 (sourceY * cmapStride);
00724 
00725             unsigned char *destPixel =
00726                 destData +
00727                 (c * 4) +
00728                 (r * destStride);
00729 
00730             *(long *)destPixel = *(long *)sourcePixel;
00731         }
00732     }
00733 }
00734 
00735 
00736 PyObject *TileEngine::getTileData(
00737     PyObject *tileFunction,
00738     PyObject *tileMap,
00739     int col,
00740     int row,
00741     int cols,
00742     int rows,
00743     int code,
00744     PyObject *tileViewCache)
00745 {
00746     if ((tileFunction != Py_None) &&
00747         !PyCallable_Check(tileFunction)) {
00748         PyErr_SetString(
00749             PyExc_TypeError,
00750             "expected tileFunction to be a callable function or None");
00751         Py_INCREF(Py_None);
00752         return Py_None;
00753     }
00754 
00755     const int *tileMapData = NULL;
00756     unsigned int tileMapCount = 0;
00757 
00758     if (tileMap != Py_None) {
00759 
00760         if (!PySequence_Check(tileMap)) {
00761             PyErr_SetString(
00762                 PyExc_TypeError,
00763                 "expected tileMap to be an array "
00764                 "of 4 byte integers or None");
00765             Py_INCREF(Py_None);
00766             return Py_None;
00767         }
00768 
00769         tileMapCount = (unsigned int)PySequence_Size(tileMap);
00770         Py_ssize_t tileMapLength = 0;
00771         if (PyObject_AsReadBuffer(
00772             tileMap,
00773             (const void **)&tileMapData,
00774             &tileMapLength) != 0) {
00775             PyErr_SetString(
00776                 PyExc_TypeError,
00777                 "expected tileMap with read buffer");
00778             Py_INCREF(Py_None);
00779             return Py_None;
00780         }
00781 
00782         int tileMapDataCount = 
00783             (int)tileMapLength / sizeof(unsigned int);
00784 
00785         if (tileMapDataCount != (int)tileMapCount) {
00786             PyErr_SetString(
00787                 PyExc_TypeError,
00788                 "expected tileMap read buffer of 4 byte integers");
00789             Py_INCREF(Py_None);
00790             return Py_None;
00791         }
00792     }
00793 
00794     int *tileViewCacheData = NULL;
00795     int tileViewCacheCount = 0;
00796 
00797     if (tileViewCache != Py_None) {
00798         tileViewCacheCount =
00799             (unsigned int)PySequence_Size(tileViewCache);
00800         Py_ssize_t tileViewCacheLength = 0;
00801         if ((tileViewCacheCount != (width * height)) ||
00802             (PyObject_AsWriteBuffer(
00803                tileViewCache,
00804                (void **)&tileViewCacheData,
00805                &tileViewCacheLength) != 0)) {
00806             PyErr_SetString(
00807                 PyExc_TypeError,
00808                 "expected tileViewCache with write buffer");
00809             Py_INCREF(Py_None);
00810             return Py_None;
00811         }
00812     }
00813 
00814     const char *textCodeString =
00815         "0123456789"
00816         "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
00817         "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ+-";
00818     int tileSize = sizeof(unsigned short);
00819     int r, c;
00820     int bufSize = 0;
00821     char *buf = NULL;
00822     bool returnBuffer = false;
00823 
00824     switch (code) {
00825 
00826         case TILE_CODE_RAW_BINARY_16: {
00827             bufSize = tileSize * rows * cols;
00828             buf = (char *)malloc(bufSize);
00829             unsigned char *dst = (unsigned char *)buf;
00830 
00831             for (r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
00832                 for (c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
00833                     int tile = 
00834                         getValue(
00835                             col + c, 
00836                             row + r, 
00837                             tileFunction, 
00838                             tileMapData, 
00839                             tileMapCount);
00840                     *dst++ = (tile >> 8) & 0xff; // High byte.
00841                     *dst++ = tile & 0xff; // Low byte.
00842                 }
00843             }
00844             break;
00845         }
00846 
00847         case TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_TEXT: {
00848             bufSize = tileSize * rows * cols * 3; // to be safe
00849             buf = (char *)malloc(bufSize);
00850             unsigned char *dst = (unsigned char *)buf;
00851             int tileIndex = 0;
00852             int tileIndexMax = rows * cols;
00853             int offset = 0;
00854             int skip = 0;
00855 
00856             while ((tileIndex < tileIndexMax) &&
00857                    (offset < bufSize)) {
00858                 int c = tileIndex % cols;
00859                 int r = tileIndex / cols;
00860                 int tileCacheOffset = 
00861                     (col + c) + ((row + r) * width);
00862 //              printf("tileIndex %d tileCacheOffset %d tileViewCacheCount %d c %d r %d cols %d rows %d ",
00863 //                  tileIndex,
00864 //                  tileCacheOffset,
00865 //                  tileViewCacheCount,
00866 //                  c, r, cols, rows);
00867                 int tile = 
00868                     getValue(
00869                         col + c, 
00870                         row + r, 
00871                         tileFunction,
00872                         tileMapData, 
00873                         tileMapCount);
00874 //              printf("tile %d\n", tile);
00875                 int curTile =
00876                     (tileViewCacheData == NULL)
00877                         ? -1
00878                         : tileViewCacheData[tileCacheOffset];
00879 
00880                 if (tile == curTile) {
00881                     skip++;
00882                 } else {
00883 //                  printf("tile %d skip %d offset %d r %d c %d index %d\n", tile, skip, offset, r, c, c + (r * width));
00884                     if (skip) {
00885                         if (skip == 1) {
00886 //                          printf("skip 1\n");
00887                             *dst++ = TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_TEXT_SKIP_0;
00888                             offset++;
00889                         } else if (skip == 2) {
00890 //                          printf("skip 2/1\n");
00891                             *dst++ = TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_TEXT_SKIP_0;
00892                             *dst++ = TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_TEXT_SKIP_0;
00893                             offset += 2;
00894                         } else if (skip < 64) {
00895 //                          printf("skip %d/64\n", skip);
00896                             int val = skip;
00897                             *dst++ = TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_TEXT_SKIP_1;
00898                             *dst++ = textCodeString[val];
00899                             offset += 2;
00900                         } else if (skip < 4096) {
00901 //                          printf("skip %d/4096\n", skip);
00902                             int val = skip;
00903                             *dst++ = TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_TEXT_SKIP_2;
00904                             *dst++ = textCodeString[(val >> 6) & 63]; // High.
00905                             *dst++ = textCodeString[val & 63]; // Low.
00906                             offset += 3;
00907                         } else {
00908 //                          printf("skip %d/999999\n", skip);
00909                             int val = skip;
00910                             *dst++ = TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_TEXT_SKIP_3;
00911                             *dst++ = textCodeString[(val >> 12) & 63]; // Highest.
00912                             *dst++ = textCodeString[(val >> 6) & 63]; // High.
00913                             *dst++ = textCodeString[val & 63]; // Low.
00914                             offset += 4;
00915                         }
00916 
00917                         skip = 0;
00918 
00919                     }
00920 
00921                     if (tileViewCacheData != NULL) {
00922                         tileViewCacheData[tileCacheOffset] = tile;
00923                     }
00924 
00925                     int low = tile & 63;
00926                     int high = (tile >> 6) & 63;
00927                     *dst++ = textCodeString[low];
00928                     *dst++ = textCodeString[high];
00929 
00930                     offset += 2;
00931                 }
00932 
00933                 tileIndex++;
00934             }
00935 
00936             bufSize = offset;
00937 
00938             break;
00939         }
00940 
00941         case TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_BINARY_16: {
00942             //returnBuffer = true; // @todo Fix pyamf code to convert buffer to ByteArray.
00943             bufSize = tileSize * rows * cols * 3; // to be safe
00944             buf = (char *)malloc(bufSize);
00945             unsigned char *dst = (unsigned char *)buf;
00946             int tileIndex = 0;
00947             int tileIndexMax = rows * cols;
00948             int offset = 0;
00949             int skip = 0;
00950 
00951             while ((tileIndex < tileIndexMax) &&
00952                    (offset < bufSize)) {
00953                 int c = tileIndex % cols;
00954                 int r = tileIndex / cols;
00955                 int tileCacheOffset = 
00956                     (col + c) + ((row + r) * width);
00957 //              printf("tileIndex %d tileCacheOffset %d tileViewCacheCount %d c %d r %d cols %d rows %d\n",
00958 //                  tileIndex,
00959 //                  tileCacheOffset,
00960 //                  tileViewCacheCount,
00961 //                  c, r, cols, rows);
00962                 int tile = 
00963                     getValue(
00964                         col + c, 
00965                         row + r, 
00966                         tileFunction,
00967                         tileMapData, 
00968                         tileMapCount);
00969 //              printf("tile %d\n", tile);
00970                 int curTile =
00971                     (tileViewCacheData == NULL)
00972                         ? -1
00973                         : tileViewCacheData[tileCacheOffset];
00974 
00975                 if (tile == curTile) {
00976                     skip++;
00977                 } else {
00978 //                  printf("tile %d skip %d offset %d r %d c %d index %d\n", tile, skip, offset, r, c, c + (r * width));
00979                     while (skip > 0) {
00980                         if (skip == 1) {
00981 //                          printf("skip 1/1\n");
00982                             // Skip of 1 is one single skip.
00983                             //printf("Skip of 1 is one single skip.\n");
00984                             *dst++ = TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_BINARY_16_SKIP_0;
00985                             offset++;
00986                             skip = 0;
00987                         } else if (skip == 2) {
00988 //                          printf("skip 2/2\n");
00989                             // Skip of 2 is two single skips.
00990                             //printf("Skip of 2 is two single skips.\n");
00991                             *dst++ = TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_BINARY_16_SKIP_0;
00992                             *dst++ = TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_BINARY_16_SKIP_0;
00993                             offset += 2;
00994                             skip = 0;
00995                         } else if (skip < (3 + 256)) {
00996 //                          printf("skip %d/258 val %d\n", skip, skip - 3);
00997                             // Skip of 3 is val of 0.
00998                             // Skip of (3 + 255)=258 is val of 255.
00999                             // Skip range 3..258 for val range 0..255.
01000                             int val = skip - 3;
01001                             //printf("Skip %d range 3..258 for val %d range 0..255.\n", skip, val);
01002                             *dst++ = TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_BINARY_16_SKIP_1;
01003                             *dst++ = val;
01004                             offset += 2;
01005                             skip = 0;
01006                         } else {
01007 //                          printf("skip %d/65794 val %d\n", skip, skip - (3 + 256));
01008                             // Skip of (3 + 256)=259 is val of 0.
01009                             // Skip of (3 + 256 + 65535)=65794 is val of 65535.
01010                             // Skip range 259..65794 for val range 0..65535.
01011                             int val = skip - (3 + 256);
01012 
01013                             // Skips greater than 65794 are broken up into repeated skips
01014                             // by the while loop above.
01015                             if (val > 65535) {
01016                                 val = 65535;
01017                             }
01018 
01019                             //printf("Skip %d range 259..65794 for val %d range 0..65535.\n", skip, val);
01020 
01021                             int high = (val >> 8) & 0xff;
01022                             int low = val & 0xff;
01023 
01024                             *dst++ = TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_BINARY_16_SKIP_2;
01025                             *dst++ = high;
01026                             *dst++ = low;
01027 
01028                             offset += 3;
01029                             skip -= val + (3 + 256);
01030                         }
01031                     }
01032 
01033                     if (tileViewCacheData != NULL) {
01034                         tileViewCacheData[tileCacheOffset] = tile;
01035                     }
01036 
01037                     int high = (tile >> 8) & 0xff;
01038                     int low = tile & 0xff;
01039 
01040                     assert(high <= TILE_CODE_COMPRESSED_BINARY_16_HIGH_MAX);
01041 
01042                     *dst++ = high;
01043                     *dst++ = low;
01044                     offset += 2;
01045                     //printf("tile high 0x%02X low 0x%02X\n", high, low);
01046                 }
01047 
01048                 tileIndex++;
01049             }
01050 
01051             bufSize = offset;
01052 
01053             break;
01054         }
01055 
01056     }
01057 
01058     PyObject *result;
01059 
01060     if (returnBuffer) {
01061         result =
01062             PyBuffer_New(bufSize);
01063         unsigned char *destBuf = NULL;
01064         Py_ssize_t destSize = 0;
01065         PyObject_AsWriteBuffer(
01066             result,
01067             (void **)&destBuf,
01068             &destSize);
01069         assert(destSize == bufSize);
01070         memcpy(
01071             destBuf,
01072             buf,
01073             destSize);
01074     } else {
01075         result =
01076             PyString_FromStringAndSize(
01077                 (const char *)buf,
01078                 bufSize);
01079     }
01080 
01081     free(buf);
01082 
01083     return result;
01084 }
